EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)  
Use-case: To extract raw materials and feed them into the transport network.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (≈2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Input chest (wooden-chest) at (2.5, 17.5)  
– Factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) placed at the factory interface  
– Secondary burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) linking the chest to production  
– Assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5) with a copper-cable recipe  
Use-case: Converting copper-plates into copper-cable for production.

### Depot Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Depot wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) serving as a belt target  
– Adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)  
– Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) (direction UP) used for transferring items  
Use-case: Acting as an intermediary connection between the extraction system output and the production network.

### Electricity Generator at position (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam engine (generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)  
– Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)  
– Offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5)  
Use-case: Generating electricity from fluid input, though lacking proper connections.

### Smelting Structures
Consists of:
– Stone furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) producing iron-plate  
– Stone furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) producing copper-plate  
Use-case: Smelting raw ores into usable plates for further processing.

### Research Lab
Consists of:
– Lab with automation-science-pack input (electrical_id=7106, status: NO_POWER)  
Use-case: Facilitating research and technology development (position not specified).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• When connecting transport belts, ensure the target is an inserter—not a steam engine. Repeated errors (Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217) indicate that transport belts must feed into an inserter that then transfers items to the intended machine.
• Before placing an entity, verify that the player is within the allowed distance. An attempt to place a wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) failed because the target was too far.
• Avoid undefined variable errors by ensuring that all target identifiers (e.g. “target_chest”) are correctly defined and referenced.
• Confirm that the required item exists in the inventory before placement. An error occurred due to the absence of a wooden chest in inventory during a placement attempt.
